if_conditional.comment: Everything in Haskell is an expression and has to return something thus there needs to be a `else` clause

if_else_conditional.code:
if condition
    then expression
    else expression

if_elseif_else_conditional.code:
if condition
    then expression
    else if condition
        then expression
        else expression

switch_statement.code:
case expression of
    "value1" -> expression
    "value2" | guard -> expression
    "value2" | another_guard -> expression
    _ -> expression -- default case

ternary_conditional.code:
if condition
    then expression
    else expression

while_loop.comment: while `whileM` is not exactly a loop it allows for very similar code, `monadBool` is a monad that returns a Bool and gets run until it returns `False`

until_loop.comment: like `whileM` this only behaves similarly to a until loop

fold_iteration.comment: haskell also supplies `foldl` and `foldl'` to provide folding with left association
